thread.title: Royal Caribbean Cruise Ship Has Small Fire in Jamaica
thread.title_full: Royal Caribbean Cruise Ship Has Small Fire in Jamaica - The New York Times

author: Shivani Vora
title: Royal Caribbean Cruise Ship Has Small Fire in Jamaica
text:
Royal Caribbean said that one of its cruise ships, Freedom of the Seas, had experienced a brief fire on Wednesday morning as it was pulling into the port of Falmouth, Jamaica. The company said the fire, which took place in a mechanical room, had been rapidly contained and extinguished.
There were no casualties among the 4,454 passengers aboard, according to the Miami-based company, and one crew member was treated for minor first-degree burns. The cause of the fire is still under investigation.
Passengers were called to assemble at their muster stations “in an abundance of caution,” the company said, but did not have to board the lifeboats.
Continue reading the main story @foxnews freedom of the seas pic.twitter.com/G1qwonOd5R
— Jayne Giesler (@MssJayne) July 22, 2015 Freedom of the Seas is currently on a seven-night sailing that departed Cape Canaveral, Fla., on Sunday, July 19, and includes port calls to Labadee, Haiti; Falmouth, Jamaica; George Town, Grand Cayman; and Cozumel, Mexico.
